commits.commitMessage:
[AVMS] Fix FOTA package download size discrepancy

Issue Description:
When device resumes FOTA firmware package upgrading after device resets
in the middle of a FOTA session, "package download size" value
decreases over time to zero instead of keeping constant.

Root Cause:
LWM2M package downloader sends LE_AVC_DOWNLOAD_IN_PROGRESS event with
parameter totalNumBytes which is set to "package download size" value.
But it isn't size of the firmware update package. It is number of bytes to
be downloaded. When firmware package downloading completes, no byte to
be downloaded, so, "package download size" value decreases to 0.

Solution:
Set size of firmware update package as "package download size".

Resolves: LE-12123 MOLWP9X07-115
Change-Id: I8fee43c2588be45fadf399b85065c337d6112677
Signed-off-by: Rinne Zhang <RiZhang@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: [AVMS] Fix FOTA package download size discrepancy

commits.commitMessage:
[AVMS] Fix QMI/AT inter-operability issues

Issue Description:
If AT command stops an AVMS session which is started by SDK Lite, SDK
Lite will fail to start AVMS session again.

Root Cause:
AVMS session state isn't synced with AirVantage server.

Solution:
Sync AVMS session state in qmiAirVantage when notification of session
stopped is received.

Resolves: LE-12479
Change-Id: Icd393c5727820ca826bc642f187141ca00da4c15
Signed-off-by: Rinne Zhang <RiZhang@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: [AVMS] Fix QMI/AT inter-operability issues

commits.commitMessage:
Update qmiAirVantage to read/write reboot prompt & APN config

Affects these two QMI messages
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SET_SETTINGS(0xA5)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_GET_SETTINGS(0xA6)

The IDL is updated to include an optional reboot prompt TLV. The
corresponding set/get settings logic calls le_mdc_{Set/Get}Apn &
le_avc_{Set/Get}UserAgreement

Resolves: LE-10513
Change-Id: I6817f1ef072c58618be05ea60bc22dad99753d8b
commits.subject: Update qmiAirVantage to read/write reboot prompt & APN config

comments.message: Add a comment header to this function
why not uint32_t and remove the cast later in 1051

Because le_data_GetCellularProfileIndex returns int32_t. Actually, this is reference from atAirVantage.c
---
int32_t le_data_GetCellularProfileIndex 
(   
    void
)
Check the pointer before using it

Done

Actually, the code path guaranteed respPtr will not set null. But agreed that it is good to null check.
I think a return status would be better (le_result_t) but since all functions in this file doesn't use a return value, you may keep it like this
This function simply populate APN if there is no error during this process. I will keep this as it is for now

The day someone decides to change LE_OK to something other than 0, this will not work anymore ^^ Better to use LE_OK for comparison instead of zero. 

Seems it's used like this in the hole code, so you may keep it like this
The reboot prompt TLV is optional. A failure to retrieve this setting should not result in failed QMI response. That is why failed flag isn't set to true here
Add a comment header to this function

commits.commitMessage:
Update qmiAirVantage user prompt settings

Affecting these two QMI messages
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SET_SETTINGS(0xA5)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_GET_SETTINGS(0xA6)

User is prompted to proceed when auto connect/update/download value is set to one
This align the behaviour with AT+WDSC

Resolves: LE-9930
Change-Id: I771e3cbe54f8884354f30b96255106fc3efd4300
commits.subject: Update qmiAirVantage user prompt settings

comments.message:
Are you sure you want to |= the results here?
Looks wrong to me... what were you trying to do?

Oh,I see what you were doing. You're only comparing to LE_OK, and as long as any one of them failed you would have != LE_OK. 

I don't like this because it's not immediately obvious what your intention was (I thought for a while you were trying to do a f1()||f2()||f3() type flow. Also, a) the error result is bogus, because you've | it, and you're making an assumption that LE_OK == 0.
Should be in an else?  I don't think you should assume bPromptUser will be set if le_avc_GetUserAgreement() fails.  Ditto below.
Even worse, it could take the previous value.
Should be modified like above, cannot apply | to le_result_t type.

BTW, terrible name for an array of timers!
I'm coming around to enforcing Hungarian notation.

Agreed, systemic naming convention accelerate code trace and maintain.

FYI, the retry_timer name is generated from the IDL which link to QMI spec[1]. I think there is nothing stopping us to rename in the IDL.
--

Update qmiAirVantage to read/write polling & retry timers

Affecting these two QMI messages
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SET_SETTINGS(0xA5)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_GET_SETTINGS(0xA6)

The IDL is updated to including optional TLVs. And corresponding set/get
settings logic calls le_avc_{Set/Get}PollingTimer & le_avc_{Set/Get}RetryTimers

In addition, the struct member naming to align with coding style

Resolves: LE-9819

commits.commitMessage:
Implement AVC2 QMI handler as Legato app

Currently implemented handler for these QMIs on basic usage:
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SESSION_START(0xA0)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SESSION_STOP(0xA1)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SESSION_GETINFO(0xA2)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_EVENT_REPOT(0xA3)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SELECTION(0xA4)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SET_SETTINGS(0xA5)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_GET_SETTINGS(0xA6)
- QMI_LEGATO_AVMS_SET_EVENT_REPORT(0xA7)

On component init, a Qmi service handler thread is launched reacting on
Qmi Request. The request then dispatch to component thread via event
and corresponding le_avc API is called. The Qmi Response is either sent
immediately or when le_avc call completes. Qmi indication is triggered
from AVC status event or Data call status event

Resolves: LE-7164
Change-Id: I5cbcc2add835ae1bac230f860e2387f506c576bb
commits.subject: Implement AVC2 QMI handler as Legato app

comments.message: Sorry, my mistake. There is not problem here.
no problem, i'm open to suggestion to improve readability in this function table
Not easy to understand this code. Could you please use macro or enum for it ?
added a local variable avms_msg_id for the 0xA0 offset.

avcSessionStart ? Please more detail.
Legato has its only naming type, Please follow it, You can refer to this file:
apps\proprietary\atAirVantage\src\atAirVantage\atAirVantage.c

avcStatusSelect ? Please more detail.
Legato has its only naming type, Please follow it, You can refer to this file:
apps\proprietary\atAirVantage\src\atAirVantage\atAirVantage.c

Could you study to move it to init function ? Example "AvcStatus" and then free it in function "stop".
Idea is: get the memory before start and free the memory before stop.

The Indications could comes after AVC session stop. So, the memory is needed during the entire component life cycle once QMI client registered.

Do you know if there is component destroy function for cleanup? That is opposite of COMPONENT_INIT

It looks there is not component destroy function for cleanup. But if the process exit (who used the component), the memory will be recycled.
I found some of the component use this function to get the memory "le_mem_CreatePool", can we use it here ?
What about to put this malloc/free in AvcStatus() or indicate_xx()? Or just define it as a local variable in the function?
If the memory would be recycled automatically, it seems no problem.
I think so. Similar to atAirVantage, the qmiAirVantage is expect to run as background once boots up. It really shouldn't exit unless crashed.
thanks. let me research a bit about le_mem APIs
The Indication struct is quite large 1xxx bytes. I try to allocate once to avoid heap fragmentation. As each indication is atomic, i.e. one after another.
Please remove all white space in this file, thanks.

The .c & .h are generated from idl.

removed trailing whitespace with:

 sed -i 's/[[:space:]]*$//' qmiAirVantage/swi_legato_service_v01.idl
Please remove all these white space.
Please remove all white space, thanks.
Keep the format same as other lines. Please remove the table key. thanks.
Maybe delete this line to be more concise...
I'm wondering if this app shouldn't be under leagato/apps/proprietary/qmiAirVantage...

I implement this as the QMI equivalent of atAirVantage. May I have you suggestion on where should it locate?
Thanks
If it is in the same folder that contains the atAirVantage app then it's okay !
Comment every enum/structure/define by adding a header (legato style) and if necessary describe the elements within each enum/structure
done, it's a big edit. Kindly let me know if you spot anything missing
Comment every function (Legato style) and parameters should be on separate lines
Comment here and before every function

void*            service_cookie
No space between * and the variable type (in all the file)
Done, shall I comment parameters for all functions?
When the parameters are easy to understand then it's fine to not comment. otherwise it's better to add comments and also tell if it's an IN or OUT parameter..
LE_INFO already prints the function name. no need to add __func__
It would be better to use dedicated APIs like le_mem_CreatePool, le_mem_TryAlloc, ... instead of malloc and free

There are two memory point that this application allocate and free. I have the le_mem doc, I would have to create two pools to manage a single allocate & free for the two sizes.

Are there any other alternatives? Please feel free to share
--
http://legato.io/legato-docs/latest/c_memory.html
